instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
This board has:

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,43
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. 2.2 to 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. 0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.56v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,43
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
1- 0
2 - 16.12
3 - 4.32
9 - 1.4
12 - 3.43
13 - 3.4
14 - 3.4
15 - 0.06
17 - 8.17
19 - 5.05
20 - 5, 05
27 - 16
I don't know what to check anymore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Inspect <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> for corrosion.
Post all its voltages.

"9 - 1.4"
Check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. 2.2 to 3.4V
--------------------------
5 - 3.4"
???

Post exact ohm resistance between pins 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
My mistake: <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. 3.4V
resistance  between pins 27/28 : 20.4 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Check again pin 9 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
There should be less than 0.5V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Now is 0,031v
<RESISTOR>R5431</RESISTOR> 45.3 kohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
So now you have steady <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
Check exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> steady 3.4v
now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.7v and falls

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message: I have the same thing and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>  it drops to 2.6v and then goes back to 3.4. Is this normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Please open new thread with your problem.
Same symptom doesn't always mean the same problem!

Post resistance between pins 17/18 too.

Remove F7140 and check <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR> voltage.
If still the same, check/replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>.
Also replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Without F7140  to the same.
I checked <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and it's ok. diode-mode  pin 1 - 0.550,  pin 2 - 0.120.
I replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> still the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
"Post resistance between pins 17/18 too."
?

Check all <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> surrounding components and traces; especially for pins 5, 7, 8.

"I checked <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and it's ok. diode-mode  pin 1 - 0.550,  pin 2 - 0.120"
I mentioned replace option, just in case you don't know how to check it; which seems to be the case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
I replaced <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> -  still the same
17/18 3.7 ohm
 I compared the <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> with a working machine. I found a broken <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> and changed. Nothing helped.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
Post again some basic voltages (F7140 in place):
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0,75v and falls (F7140 pin.2)
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> and falls (F7140 pin.1)
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  3.4v (<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR>)
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0v (<RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR>)
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>  0v (<RESISTOR>R5198</RESISTOR>)
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0v (<RESISTOR>R5185</RESISTOR>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
If you don't get voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR>, when F7140 is removed, then your problem is on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area.
Post again <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages (F7140 removed).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
I measured with f7140.
Without F7140: <CAPACITOR>C7140</CAPACITOR> pin.1 0,75v and falls. 
Will soon publish the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> without F7140

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
"3 - 0v"
ACIN misssing.
Check diode mode to ground first.
If short/low, remove <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> and check again.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> is good.
If still low, change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 Not Turning On
threads.message:
I replaced it again <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and everything works. 
The previous chip must have been damaged.
